title: Will filing a chapter 7 bankruptcy prior to marriage affect my new spouse
question: I am going to get married in the next 6 months but I need to file a chpt. 7 bk before doing so. If I file the chpt 7 bk would this have any affect on my future spouse? What if the chpt 7 wasn't discharged yet?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Spousal debt,Marriage
answers:
Assuming that you receive your discharge before you are married, and you have no joint debt, it should not directly affect your future spouse.

Brett Weiss
brett@BankruptcyLawMaryland.com

CA is as you probably know a community property state. This means that what you have before the marriage is separate. The bankruptcy is your separate proceeding and the underlying debts are yours. It will not directly affect your future spouse except that the two of you will have difficulty getting credit together.
